tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE sensitive_data_changes (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    user_id INT,
    change_description TEXT,
    old_value TEXT,
    new_value TEXT
)

CREATE TABLE access_controls (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  user_id INT,
  access_level VARCHAR(20) NOT NULL,
  last_accessed TIMESTAMP NOT NULL,
  FOREIGN KEY (user_id) REFERENCES passwords(id)
);

CREATE TABLE audit_logs (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    action TEXT NOT NULL,
    table_name TEXT NOT NULL,
    user_id INT NOT NULL,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP NOT NULL
);

CREATE TABLE user_logs (
    log_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    user_id INT,
    action VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP NOT NULL,
    FOREIGN KEY (user_id) REFERENCES users(id)
);

CREATE TABLE access_controls (
    control_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    user_id INT,
    resource VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    access_level VARCHAR(20) NOT NULL,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP NOT NULL,
    FOREIGN KEY (user_id) REFERENCES users(id)
);

CREATE TABLE password_history (
    history_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    user_id INT,
    old_password VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP NOT NULL,
    FOREIGN KEY (user_id) REFERENCES users(id)
);

CREATE TABLE password_changes (
    change_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    password_id INT NOT NULL,
    changed_by INT NOT NULL,
    change_timestamp TIMESTAMP NOT NULL,
    old_password_hash VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    new_password_hash VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL
);

CREATE TABLE access_changes (
    change_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    access_id INT NOT NULL,
    changed_by INT NOT NULL,
    change_timestamp TIMESTAMP NOT NULL,
    old_access_level VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    new_access_level VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL
);
